subject: Philosophy
title: Heidegger's Being and Time
description: Learn Heidegger's Being and Time in one minute.

hook.text: Heidegger asked the question everyone forgot: what does it mean for something to 'be'?

buildup.text: Being and Time argues we've been so busy with things in the world that we forgot about being itself.

discovery.text: He coined 'Dasein' â€” being-there. Humans don't just exist; they're aware of existing.

twist.text: Heidegger joined the Nazi Party in 1933. His philosophy's brilliance is shadowed by moral failure.

climax.text: The debate continues: can you separate a thinker's ideas from their actions? Heidegger makes this hard.

punchline.text: His ideas endure. His choices haunt them.
